Workers today collaborate, communicate, and interact within large companies with complex networks.

Network engineers design enterprise networks to provide reliable high-speed communication channels between remote sites.

Data moves through the enterprise hierarchy based on the IP address of the remote network.

Routing protocols continually exchange information on the best path through the network.

After completion of this chapter, you should be able to:
Compare and contrast a flat network and a hierarchical routed topology.
Configure a network using RIP v2.
Describe and plan a network using EIGRP.
Design and configure a network using EIGRP .
